algorithm_technique: Hashmap for character-to-index mapping and iterative calculation
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the time to type a word on a single-row keyboard, given the layout and starting position.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a hashmap to store character positions for O(1) lookup, then iterates through the word, summing absolute differences in indices.
key_insights: A hashmap (dictionary) is ideal for quickly mapping characters to their positions on the keyboard.
Iterating through the word and keeping track of the previous character's position allows for incremental time calculation.
The absolute difference between consecutive character positions represents the movement time.
